Google Reports State-Backed Hackers Using Gemini AI for Recon and Attack Support

AI 5 min read

Google has issued a report highlighting that state-sponsored hackers are increasingly utilizing Gemini AI technology to enhance their cyber operations. These hackers employ the AI for both reconnaissance and active attack support, which allows them to efficiently gather intelligence and bolster their strategies during cyberattacks. This development signifies a sophisticated evolution in the tactics used by these groups, emphasizing the need for robust cybersecurity measures. Google's findings underscore the rising threat of AI-powered cyber activities and the critical importance of staying vigilant against these advanced threats.

AI 5 min read

The article "Zero-Sacrifice Persistent-Robustness Adversarial Defense for Pre-Trained Encoders" presents a novel framework designed to enhance the adversarial robustness of pre-trained neural network encoders without sacrificing their performance. The proposed method introduces a zero-sacrifice mechanism that effectively defends against adversarial attacks while maintaining the original accuracy and efficiency of the encoders. MELINOE: Fine-Tuning Enables Memory-Efficient Inference for Mixture-of-Experts Models

AI 5 min read

The article discusses MELINOE, an innovative approach designed to enhance memory efficiency in mixture-of-experts (MoE) models during inference. MoE models, known for their capability to scale and improve model performance, often face challenges related to memory consumption, particularly when deployed in resource-constrained environments. MELINOE proposes a fine-tuning method that optimizes the allocation of expert computational resources, reducing the memory footprint without compromising the accuracy or effectiveness of the model. RIP Dave Farber, EFF Board Member and Friend

Tech 5 min read

Dave Farber, a renowned computer scientist and esteemed board member of the Electronic Frontier Foundation (EFF), has passed away. Known for his significant contributions to the field of computer science and internet policy, Farber's work left a lasting impact on technology and digital rights advocacy. His career included influential roles in academia and industry, where he was often recognized as a pivotal figure in the development of networking technology.
